required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Testing of a Social Cognitive Theory-based Dietary Behavioral Intervention in Gastric Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Testing of a Social Cognitive Theory-based Dietary Behavioral Intervention in Gastric Cancer Survivors: Protocol for a Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to develop a Social Cognitive Theory-based dietary behavioral intervention for gastric cancer survivors, and explore the feasibility, acceptability, and preliminary effectiveness of delivering this intervention. Two phases are covered in this study, including development of the intervention in phase 1 and a pilot randomized controlled trial (RCT) in phase 2. For the phase 1, a qualitative descriptive study will be conducted to enrich the initial intervention protocol, which has been formed based on the Social Cognitive Theory and literature review. Furthermore, an expert consultation will be conducted to validate and refine the initial intervention protocol. For the phase 2, a pilot RCT will be conducted to test the feasibility, acceptability, and preliminary effectiveness of the proposed intervention. All participants will be recruited from a tertiary hospital in Wuhan city, China.
For the qualitative descriptive study in phase 1, gastric cancer survivors will be recruited through purposive sampling to attend focus group interviews. Number of focus groups will be at least four, but the final sample size being determined by data saturation. Data will be analyzed through qualitative content analysis. Based on qualitative data, the intervention content will be validated and /or refined by a panel of multidisciplinary experts.
For the pilot RCT in phase 2, 72 gastric cancer survivors will be recruited through convenience sampling. After randomization, the participants will be assigned to one of two groups, either the intervention group, which will receive a 6-week dietary behavioral intervention; or the control group, which will receive usual care only. The 6-week dietary behavioral intervention will target six dietary behaviors that are relevant to gastric cancer and will be delivered by a registered nurse and a registered dietician. The intervention consists of three face-to-face group-education with 10-12 participants in each group and three individual telephone counselling sessions. The usual care will be general dietary advice provided by the nurses before discharge from the hospital. The general dietary advice will be provided orally and printed in the discharge plan. The primary outcomes will be feasibility and acceptability. The secondary outcomes will be dietary consumption, quality of life, and self-efficacy. Outcome measurements will be conducted at baseline (before randomization), and week 7 (after intervention). Generalized estimating equation model analyses will be conducted to examine group-by-time interaction effects.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility outcome: time to complete the recruitment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
primary_outcome.description: Time to complete the recruitment will be assessed by the time duration from the beginning to the completion of the recruitment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
primary_outcome.description: Eligibility rate will be calculated by dividing the number of participants eligible by the number of participants screened.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
primary_outcome.description: Recruitment rate will be calculated by dividing the number of eligible participants who have consented and been randomized by the total number of eligible participants.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
primary_outcome.description: Retention rate will be calculated by dividing the number of participants completed the study with valid outcome data by the number of participants randomized.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
primary_outcome.description: Attendance rate will be calculated by dividing the number of participants completed at least 5 sessions of the 6 sessions by the number of participants assigned to the intervention group.

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability outcome: participants' satisfaction and perspectives of the intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
primary_outcome.description: Participants' satisfaction and perspectives of the intervention will be assessed using a self-developed questionnaire designed for the study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before randomization (T0); Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Dietary consumption will be measured through telephone-assisted 24-hour dietary recall in three non-consecutive days (E.g., two workdays and one day during the weekend)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before randomization (T0); Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Health-related quality of life will be assessed using the 46-item Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Gastric (FACT-Ga) questionnaire. Each item is scored from 0 to 4 and the total score range from 0 to 184, with a higher score indicating better quality of life.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before randomization (T0); Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: General self-efficacy will be assessed using the 10-item general self-efficacy scale. Each item is scored from 0 to 4 and the total score range from 0 to 40, with a higher score indicating higher general self-efficacy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before randomization (T0); Immediately after completion of the intervention (T1)
secondary_outcome.description: Dietary behavior self-efficacy will be assessed using a self-developed 6-item dietary behavior self-efficacy scale. Each item is scored from 0 to 4 and the total score range from 0 to 24, with a higher score indicating higher dietary behavior self-efficacy.

arm_group.description: A 6-week dietary behavioral intervention provided by a registered nurse and a registered dietitian.
General dietary advice provided by the nurses.

intervention.description: The intervention will last for 6 weeks and target 6 dietary behaviors that are relevant to gastric cancer. The intervention components include 3 sessions of online group education with 10-12 participants in each group and 3 sessions of individual telephone counselling.
General dietary advice provided as routine by the nurses in the hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult aged 18 years or above；
- A confirmed diagnosis of gastric cancer (stage I-III)；
- Completed primary cancer treatments including surgery, chemotherapy and/or radiotherapy；
- Currently free of cancer；
- Able to read, write and speak Mandarin.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to eat orally；
- With poor performance status as determined by the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) scores ≥ 2;
- With poor cognitive status as determined by the Montreal Cognitive Assessment 5 minute Test <11;
- Taking part in other dietary interventions or under regular follow-up by a dietitian.
